title: 105_hr3687
content:
The Act titled "Canadian River Project Prepayment Act" defines key terms such as Authority, Canadian River Project Authorization Act, Project, and Secretary. The Authority refers to the Canadian River Municipal Water Authority in Texas, while the Project encompasses the land and facilities authorized by the Canadian River Project Authorization Act. The Secretary mentioned is the Secretary of the Interior. SEC. 3. PREPAYMENT AND CONVEYANCE OF PROJECT. The Secretary will convey the Project to the Authority upon payment of $34,806,731 within 270 days of the enactment of the Act, or adjusted with interest if paid later. The Authority must make payment within a specified period for the Act to be effective. The Act does not impact the Authority's financing options. SEC. 4. RELATIONSHIP TO EXISTING OPERATIONS. The Act does not expand or change the current use of the Project. Any future alterations must comply with applicable laws. The Lake Meredith National Recreation Area will continue to be operated by the National Park Service. Regulations for flood control at Lake Meredith will be maintained by the Corps of Engineers. The Authority will have rights to the Sanford Dam Property. The Authority has the right to occupy and use the property at Sanford Dam without payment, including buildings constructed by the United States. The Authority will operate and maintain the property and facilities at no cost to the United States. SEC. 5. RELATIONSHIP TO CERTAIN CONTRACT OBLIGATIONS.

Provision of consideration by the Authority in accordance with section 3(b) shall extinguish all payment obligations under contract numbered 14-06-500-485 between the Authority and the Secretary. The Authority will have full responsibility for the cost of operation and maintenance of Sanford Dam, the Project pipeline, and related facilities. Rights and obligations under the existing contract between the Authority and the United States, other than repayment of construction charges and provisions related to the Project aqueduct, will remain in effect. Upon conveyance of the Project under this Act, the Reclamation Act of 1902 and all related Acts shall not apply. The United States shall not be liable for damages related to the conveyed property.
